title: Eamonn Holmes caught checking phone during Shalamar performance live on air
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Eamonn Holmes was caught on his phone during Shalamar’s performance on This Morning.

The host had introduced the band, who are currently touring the UK, and headed off to the sofa to watch their rendition of A Night To Remember.

But while the group were midway through their set, the camera panned out and captured the 59-year-old staring at his screen.

Viewers were quick to spot the faux pas, and called the presenter out on his actions.

Taking to Twitter, one wrote: ‘I love him. No f**ks given,’ while another shared a clip of the moment and added: ‘When you are bored at a concert… #thismorning.’

Eamonn Holmes caught checking phone during Shalamar performance (Picture: ITV)

‘Eammon on his phone. What a mood,’ another viewer said.

Others, however, were more focused on the singing, with someone commenting: ‘Oh I loved that!! Got me right in the Friday mood!’

As a fan also wrote: ‘Aww I was a snotty lil 6 year old when this song came out in 82 , not feeling slightly old at all lol.’

The duo are yet to mention phone-gate, but we’re not too sure Eamonn knows he was caught.

Earlier on in the show, the pair got chatting to a woman who had rescued and lives with 27 paralysed dogs.

Claire Louise, who runs the charity Wheels To Paws UK, spoke to Alison Hammond about her non-profit organisation.

And while surrounded by her pack, the pooch lover couldn’t help but joke about their names.

Pointing to one of her fur babies, Claire laughed: ‘That one is called Elton John because he was paralysed but he is still standing.’

She continued to explain her situation, adding: ‘Basically, they come from all over the world. We started off with Thomas Cook, and he does like to travel.’

This Morning continues weekdays at 10.30am on ITV.
